summary: This is a superseding indictment filed in the Southern District of New York against Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with six counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors, including conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, enticement, transportation of a minor, and perjury. The document details her alleged role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of at least three minor victims by Jeffrey Epstein between 1994 and 1997, and her subsequent false statements under oath in 2016.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury for her alleged role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The financier who sexually abused minor girls, with Maxwell's alleged assistance in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating access to victims.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The Acting U.S. Attorney who signed the superseding indictment.

connections.description: Alleged conspirators in a scheme to entice and transport minors for illegal sexual activity. They had a personal and professional relationship, including an intimate relationship and Maxwell managing Epstein's properties.
Maxwell allegedly assisted, facilitated, and contributed to Epstein's abuse of minor victims by recruiting, grooming, and being present during abuse.

events.title: Period of Alleged Conspiracy and Abuse
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to entice and transport minor victims across state lines and internationally for the purpose of sexual abuse. Specific grooming and abuse events involving Minor Victim-1, Minor Victim-2, and Minor Victim-3 occurred during this period.

events.title: Maxwell's Deposition and Alleged Perjury
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell provided sworn testimony in a civil deposition where she allegedly made false statements about her knowledge of Epstein's scheme, her interactions with minors, and her own actions.

events.title: First Alleged Perjurious Deposition
events.description: Maxwell allegedly gave false testimony under oath, denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls and claiming she was not aware of interacting with anyone under 18 other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Second Alleged Perjurious Deposition
events.description: Maxwell allegedly gave false testimony under oath, denying awareness of sex toys at Epstein's home, knowledge of his sexual activities with others, and ever giving massages to anyone, including Epstein and Minor Victim-2.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Ranch)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the legal proceedings)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with six federal crimes: conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and two counts of perjury.

The indictment alleges Maxwell played a central role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the sexual abuse of at least three minor girls (identified as Minor Victim-1, -2, and -3) for Jeffrey Epstein from 1994 to 1997.
Specific grooming tactics are detailed, including befriending victims, discussing sexual topics, undressing in front of them, and encouraging 'sexualized massages' that led to abuse.
The abuse allegedly occurred at multiple Epstein properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and at Maxwell's London home, involving interstate and international travel of victims.

Maxwell is accused of committing perjury during 2016 civil depositions by denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme, her interactions with minors, and her own participation in massages and sexual activities.
